column2: Export quota imposed on Maize + Soybeans by India
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Export quotas (or prescribed maximum volume of permitted exports) imposed on Maize + Soybeans by India are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) , in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified in the source document), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members, or for 'shared groups' of commodities. A 'shared group' is the group of commodities among which the quota is shared. The lists of selected product codes and shared groups are available as metadata attachment. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Maize + Soybeans in India, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).
column21: Volume (e.g. tonnes) or volume per period (e.g. tonnes/month) as reported by the official source. If no end date is specified in the source document, then the quota finishes once it is filled
column28: Under the G20 AMIS Initiative the AMIS Secretariat collects the information needed using several different sources and methods. OECD has taken the lead in creating a database that collects information on policies that are likely to affect the functioning of world food markets.
column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. Rather AMIS combines existing information with improved data. Sources: WTO provides regularly data on import tariffs, tariff quotas and export subsidies; OECD provides once a year data on agricultural domestic support (PSE/CSE database); OECD has provided initial data on agricultural export restrictions and biofuel policies (future updates are expected to be provided by the network of focal points under the coordination of the OECD).
column30: Policies are targeted at a specific commodity or at a specific group of commodities. In addition, policy conditions or policy specifications might be recorded. The resource does not distinguish between specific commodities or policy specifications. As a result, comparisons within a given resource can be limited.
column33: Data are collected from official legal documents, government websites and other reliable sources, which are publicly available.
column34: Historical data are extracted from the OECD Database on Restrictions on Exports of Raw Materials. Structure, nomenclature and content of the fields are harmonised with the AMIS Policy Database structure and terminology. Recent data are entered following the AMIS Policy Database structure and terminology.
column35: Historical data are extracted from the OECD Database on Restrictions on Exports of Raw Materials; updates provided by OECD and country focal points.
column38: Online with possibility to download the data in Excel
column45: Notifications Directorate General of Foreign Trade
column60: TPR Trade policy review by country (Government report)
column62: On this page you can find TPRs by country or you can consult the full chronological list of TPRs with links to the press releases.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Export quota imposed on Wheat by India, with conditions
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Export quotas (or prescribed maximum volume of permitted exports) imposed on Wheat by India, with conditions, are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1001, 1101, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1109, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified in the source document), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members, or for 'shared groups' of commodities. A 'shared group' is the group of commodities among which the quota is shared. The lists of selected product codes and shared groups are available as metadata attachment. The field 'Condition' specifies when the application of the policy measure or the value to be applied depends on certain conditions that can be related to the commodity (specification, product packaging, quantities, etc.), countries, firms, etc. Exemptions might apply.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO

column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Maize notified by Indonesia are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1005, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1507, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Maize in Indonesia, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. Sources: WTO provides regularly data on import tariffs, tariff quotas and export subsidies; OECD provides once a year data on agricultural domestic support (PSE/CSE database); OECD has provided initial data on agricultural export restrictions and biofuel policies (future updates are expected to be provided by the network of focal points under the coordination of the OECD).
column30: Policies are targeted at a specific commodity or at a specific group of commodities. In addition, policy conditions or policy specifications might be recorded. column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column19: Export quotas (or prescribed maximum volume of permitted exports) imposed on Maize by Argentina are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1005, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1507, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified in the source document), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members, or for 'shared groups' of commodities. column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

Subsidies are recorded in quantity (tonnes) and monetary value and the database distinguishes notified and committed values.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Import tariffs on Rice notified by Australia
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Rice notified by Australia are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1006, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Rice in Australia, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).
column21: Percentage (ad valorem tax) or price per quantity (e.g. USD/tonne)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Soybeans notified by Australia are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1201, 1208, 1507, 2304, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Soybeans in Australia, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).
column21: Percentage (ad valorem tax) or price per quantity (e.g. USD/tonne)
column28: Under the G20 AMIS Initiative the AMIS Secretariat collects the information needed using several different sources and methods. OECD has taken the lead in creating a database that collects information on policies that are likely to affect the functioning of world food markets.
column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. Rather AMIS combines existing information with improved data. Sources: WTO provides regularly data on import tariffs, tariff quotas and export subsidies; OECD provides once a year data on agricultural domestic support (PSE/CSE database); OECD has provided initial data on agricultural export restrictions and biofuel policies (future updates are expected to be provided by the network of focal points under the coordination of the OECD).
column30: Policies are targeted at a specific commodity or at a specific group of commodities. In addition, policy conditions or policy specifications might be recorded. The resource does not distinguish between specific commodities or policy specifications. As a result, comparisons within a given resource can be limited.
column33: Data are collected by WTO and published in the WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Datbase (applied tariffs).
column34: Data are extracted from the WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Database (applied tariffs). Structure, nomenclature and content of the fields are harmonised with the AMIS Policy Database structure and terminology.
column35: WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Database (applied tariffs).
column38: Online with possibility to download the data in Excel
column47: ComLaw has the most complete and up-to-date collection of Commonwealth legislation and includes notices from the Commonwealth Government Notices Gazette from 1 October 2012.
column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Market price support (MPS) for Soybeans provided by Australia, with conditions
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Market price support (MPS) transfers for Soybeans provided by Australia, with conditions, arising from policy measures that create a gap between domestic market prices and border prices of the specific agricultural commodity, measured at the farm gate level are recorded here as estimated by the OECD. The product classification corresponds to the one employed by the OECD for the PSE calculations.

column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Import tariffs on Rice notified by Turkey

column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Rice notified by Turkey are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1006, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Export subsidies for Maize notified by Turkey
column5: tr, some fields completed using the national language (e.g. Subnational_Name).
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Export subsidies for Maize notified by Turkey are recorded for commodity groups ('shared groups'), each group being associated with one or more HS codes of the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of shared groups and associated HS codes is available as attachment. Subsidies are recorded in quantity (tonnes) and monetary value and the database distinguishes notified and committed values.

column2: Export subsidies for Rice notified by United States of America
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column18: Export subsidies, Rice, United States of America
column19: Export subsidies for Rice notified by United States of America are recorded for commodity groups ('shared groups'), each group being associated with one or more HS codes of the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of shared groups and associated HS codes is available as attachment. Subsidies are recorded in quantity (tonnes) and monetary value and the database distinguishes notified and committed values.

column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO

column19: Export subsidies for Maize + Soybeans notified by Brazil are recorded for commodity groups ('shared groups'), each group being associated with one or more HS codes of the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. Subsidies are recorded in quantity (tonnes) and monetary value and the database distinguishes notified and committed values.

column2: Import tariffs on Rice notified by Canada
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Rice notified by Canada are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1006, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. column2: Export subsidies for Maize + Rice + Wheat notified by European Union
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column18: Export subsidies, Maize + Rice + Wheat, European Union
column19: Export subsidies for Maize + Rice + Wheat notified by European Union are recorded for commodity groups ('shared groups'), each group being associated with one or more HS codes of the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of shared groups and associated HS codes is available as attachment. Subsidies are recorded in quantity (tonnes) and monetary value and the database distinguishes notified and committed values.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Wheat notified by European Union are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1001, 1101, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1109, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Wheat in European Union, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).
column21: Percentage (ad valorem tax) or price per quantity (e.g. USD/tonne)
column28: Under the G20 AMIS Initiative the AMIS Secretariat collects the information needed using several different sources and methods. OECD has taken the lead in creating a database that collects information on policies that are likely to affect the functioning of world food markets.
column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. Rather AMIS combines existing information with improved data. Sources: WTO provides regularly data on import tariffs, tariff quotas and export subsidies; OECD provides once a year data on agricultural domestic support (PSE/CSE database); OECD has provided initial data on agricultural export restrictions and biofuel policies (future updates are expected to be provided by the network of focal points under the coordination of the OECD).
column30: Policies are targeted at a specific commodity or at a specific group of commodities. In addition, policy conditions or policy specifications might be recorded. The resource does not distinguish between specific commodities or policy specifications. As a result, comparisons within a given resource can be limited.
column33: Data are collected by WTO and published in the WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Datbase (applied tariffs).
column34: Data are extracted from the WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Database (applied tariffs). Structure, nomenclature and content of the fields are harmonised with the AMIS Policy Database structure and terminology.
column35: WTO Consolidated Tariff Schedule Database (bound tariffs) or the WTO Integrated Database (applied tariffs).
column38: Online with possibility to download the data in Excel
column47: EU law and other public EU documents, authentic electronic Official Journal of the EU in 24 languages.
column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column19: Tariff quotas on Rice notified by European Union are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 1006, 1102, 1103, 1104, 1108, 1515, 1904, 2302, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.
column20: Policy measures targeted at Rice in European Union, excluding measures that are not targeted at individual producers or consumers (e.g. measures on research and development).
column21: In quota bound tariff is reported in percentage (ad valorem tax) or price per quantity (e.g. USD/tonne). Quota quantities are reported in volume.
column28: Under the G20 AMIS Initiative the AMIS Secretariat collects the information needed using several different sources and methods. OECD has taken the lead in creating a database that collects information on policies that are likely to affect the functioning of world food markets.
column29: AMIS does not duplicate or attempt to replace existing systems and consideration is given not to unduly increase the volume of information which governments participating in AMIS will be requested to supply. Rather AMIS combines existing information with improved data. Sources: WTO provides regularly data on import tariffs, tariff quotas and export subsidies; OECD provides once a year data on agricultural domestic support (PSE/CSE database); OECD has provided initial data on agricultural export restrictions and biofuel policies (future updates are expected to be provided by the network of focal points under the coordination of the OECD).
column30: Policies are targeted at a specific commodity or at a specific group of commodities. In addition, policy conditions or policy specifications might be recorded. The resource does not distinguish between specific commodities or policy specifications. As a result, comparisons within a given resource can be limited.
column33: Data are collected by WTO and published in the WTO Members Notifications Database.
column34: Data are extracted from the WTO Members Notifications Database. Structure, nomenclature and content of the fields are harmonised with the AMIS Policy Database structure and terminology.
column35: WTO Members Notifications Database
column38: Online with possibility to download the data in Excel
column47: EU law and other public EU documents, authentic electronic Official Journal of the EU in 24 languages.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)

column2: Import tariffs on Biodiesel notified by European Union
column11: Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
column19: Customs duties on merchandise imports of Biodiesel notified by European Union are recorded for selected products and subproducts belonging to the HS4 code(s) 3824, 3826, in version HS2007 or HS2012 (as specified by the source), based on the internationally standardized product nomenclature, the Harmonized System (HS), which is used by WTO Members. The list of selected product codes is available in the methodology document. Exemptions might apply.

column84: TAO - Tariff Analysis Online facility provided by WTO
column86: This facility allows you to access the WTO's Integrated Data Base (IDB) and Consolidated Tariff Schedules (CTS) database on-line, select markets and products, compile reports and download data. The two databases contain applied customs duties at the tariff line level, import statistics by country of origin and WTO Members' commitments on goods (bound tariffs and specific commitments in agriculture)
